quote: Yet say he is in love. There is no appearance of fancy in him, unless it be a fancy that he hath to strange disguises, as to be a Dutchman today, a Frenchman tomorrow, or in the shape of two countries at once, as a German from the waist downward, all slops, and a Spaniard from the hip upward, no doublet.
--Why, what read you there that have so cowarded and chased your blood out of appearance?
Pray you, pass on. Will not tarry; no, nor ever more upon this business my appearance make in any of their courts.
